sentences.en: Frolicsome students celebrated their graduation with parties and practical jokes.
sentences.cn: 爱玩闹的学生们举行聚会,制造各种恶作剧来庆祝毕业.

sentences.en: He and Helen celebrated their silver wedding last year.
sentences.cn: 他和海伦去年庆祝了他们的银婚。

sentences.en: He has become celebrated as an artist.
sentences.cn: 他已成为大名鼎鼎的艺术家了.

sentences.en: He was soon one of the most celebrated young painters in England.
sentences.cn: 不久他就成了英格兰最负盛名的年轻画家之一。

sentences.en: His Eminence Cardinal Hume celebrated Mass.
sentences.cn: 休谟红衣主教大人主持了弥撒。

sentences.en: The actor was celebrated for drinking too much.
The city is celebrated for its beautiful scenery.
sentences.cn: 该市以其美丽的风景著名.

sentences.en: The couple celebrated their golden wedding in January.
sentences.cn: 这对夫妇一月份举行了他们的金婚大庆。

sentences.en: The names of many heroes are celebrated by the poets.
sentences.cn: 许多英雄的名字为诗人所歌颂.

sentences.en: The Pontiff celebrated mass in Mexico City.
sentences.cn: 教皇在墨西哥城主持了弥撒。

sentences.en: Their lives interconnect with those of celebrated figures of the late eighteenth-century.
sentences.cn: 他们的生活与18世纪晚期的名人联系在一起。

sentences.en: They celebrated their silver wedding in May.
sentences.cn: 他们于五月份庆祝了银婚纪念日。

sentences.en: They celebrated their win, in time - honoured fashion, by spraying champagne everywhere.
sentences.cn: 他们用四处喷香槟的这种传统方式庆祝胜利.

sentences.en: Tom celebrated his 24th birthday two days ago.
sentences.cn: 汤姆两天前庆祝了他的24岁生日。

words.tran_cn: 庆祝；过节；举行宗教仪式

trans.tran_cn: 庆祝，庆贺（“celebrate“的过去式和过去分词），主持宗教仪式（尤指圣餐），颂扬，赞美
